selectedVerses.text: To rouse my wrath, to take vengeance, I have set on the bare rock the blood she has shed, that it may not be covered.
He crouched, he lay down like a lion and like a lioness; who will rouse him up? Blessed are those who bless you, and cursed are those who curse you."
Let those curse it who curse the day, who are ready to rouse up Leviathan.
Like a dream when one awakes, O Lord, when you rouse yourself, you despise them as phantoms.
Awake and rouse yourself for my vindication, for my cause, my God and my Lord!
